definitions.title: m.
definitions.body: ] stall (lit: tying-place);—´[[עֲגָלִים מִתּוֹךְ מ]]: Am 6:4 calves out of the stall (where they were fattened); ´[[עֵגֶל־מ]]: 1Sa 28:24 i.e. a stall-fed, fatted, calf; so ´[[כְּעֶנְלֵי מ]]: Mal 3:20 (sim. of prosperity), Je 46:21 (sim. of well-fed and arrogant mercenaries).
